block_list.title: Video Tutorial
block_list.body: Today we are going to learn how to fold WXYZ by Tung Ken Lam. This is an amazing model. It is a kusudama star with 4 intersecting triangles. As I am an Engineer, therefore part of me is a mathematician, the mathematician is screaming with joy. This model is a physical model of 4 intersecting planes in 3 dimensional space. I hope you enjoy it as mush as I do. To make this model you will need 12 pieces of paper to make 12 modules. Ideally 4 colors for the 4 different planes. Therefore 3 modules for each color. Here at Heap Art, we are trying to inspire people to connect with each other through origami and paper folding. Subscribe to my channel to receive something new every week. If you like Paper Airplanes and you like Origami. Please subscribe to my channel using the link below: https://www.youtube.com/c/heapart?sub_confirmation=1 Below is the time table of the Tutorial! 0:00 Model Demo 0:13 Folding The Module 3:01 Module Time lapse 3:17 Adding the First Corner 4:07 Adding the Second Corner 6:04 Adding the Last Corner

block_list.title: More Designs from Tung Ken Lam
